response_parsed.title: Packaging Notebooks for Production with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to convert Jupyter notebooks into a production-ready API using FastAPI and Python 3.12+. The process involves converting the notebook to a Python script, creating a virtual environment, setting up FastAPI, and deploying the app.
key_points: Convert notebook to Python script using nbconvert
Write a main application file with FastAPI routes
Run the FastAPI app locally for testing
Deploy the FastAPI app to your preferred platform

code_examples.code: source fastapi_venv/bin/activate && pip install fastapi uvicorn[standard] requests

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
The example uses FastAPI version 0.76.0 and Uvicorn version 0.17.6.
This guide demonstrates the process on a Unix-based system.
caveats: Ensure your notebook contains all necessary dependencies before converting it to Python script.
You may need to adjust the Dockerfile according to your deployment platform's specifications.
Be mindful of security concerns when working with FastAPI applications.
